group_1.textLeft: Oh this is so dull...@By the way, what sorta gathering is this?

group_1.textRight: The school assembly right? I kinda remember...@some kinda student council...

group_1.textLeft: Hey, let's blow it off quickly.

group_1.textRight: What's with that attitude...@and what's with that hair color?

group_1.textLeft: Hey asshole, quit pickin' a fight as a teacher.

group_1.textRight: If you obeyed the school regulations and behaved@then I wouldn't be correcting you like—

group_1.textLeft: I mean this, it's my own hair.
You know nothin'...@The reason why he turned delinquent...
...is that he had to dye his hair 'cause of them@regulations when he was a middle-schooler.

group_1.textRight: A-anyway regulations are regulations, so just dye@that hair by next week...

group_1.textCenter: ...Mm-hmm.@The place is troubled just perfectly.
But that's just why it is worthwhile and rewarding@to do the reform.
We will now begin the school assembly.
To begin with, we have a message from the@vice-principal.
Uhh...@I think everybody already knows but...
We have a student council election at the end of@next month.
So today, we will have a greeting from each@candidate.
Students should listen carefully and take in@information to refer to for voting.
First up is Hasebe, who is running as a candidate for@the secretary of the middle school division's student@council.
Please come over to the rostrum.

group_1.textRight: I mean, how many of them do we have here?

group_1.textLeft: This is indeed going to be dull.

group_1.textCenter: ...And that is all the reasons why I am running as a@candidate for student council president.
Pleased to talk to you, everyone!
It's finally over...

group_1.textLeft: Yeah, let's go back to the classroom.

group_1.textRight: Huh?@Another one is stepping onto the rostrum.

group_1.textCenter: Wha...@There's still more?
And the last candidate we have is a 1st year in the@high school division, Yuna Kureha.
...Yuna Kureha...?
For this occasion, I, Yuna Kureha, am running for@student council president.
[chara:102201:effect_emotion_surprise_0][se:7226_shock]...?!
That girl...@Yesterday!

group_1.textRight: No, I think the previous candidate was the last one...

group_1.textLeft: You can only run for the student council president@as a 2nd year, right?
While that girl, is a 1st year they say...

group_1.textRight: ...That Kureha girl has been talking to the MC girl@before the assembly began...

group_1.textLeft: Could it mean that she laid the groundwork to push@her way onto the podium...?

group_1.textCenter: First off, allow me to ask you all a question.
Do you think this school gives freedom?
I didn't think so.
Fights between students and quarrels between a@student and a teacher...
Anytime anywhere, someone is yelling at someone@else.
But to me, it doesn't seem that everyone is seeking@disputes.
At the school festival or sports day, we can see@students working together...
...to create their own school life voluntarily.
Such a wonderful spirit can be seen.
If so, what is bringing anger to this school?
It's simple; this school gives no freedom.
In other words, there are too many unreasonable@rules that restrict freedom.
For example..."Male students are not allowed to@have their hair reaching below their ears."
"Hair color must be black regardless of the natural@hair color."
These are the remains from the educational policy@long ago.
I don't think these kinds of rules are necessary to@the present-day world and to us.
If I get elected president...
I am going to replace these rules with "New School@Regulations" that I contemplated independently.
*Chuckle*
As a symbolic starter, I will revise the regulations@about hairstyle and hair color.
What do you all think about this?
I will keep my commitments.@So please, will you follow me?
In any case, if you agree with my idea even if@only a bit...
...Put those hands together and please applaud!
Yes...louder!@Clap those hands!

group_1.narration: *Clap Clap Clap Clap!!*@*Clap Clap Clap Clap!!*@*Clap Clap Clap Clap!!*@*Clap Clap Clap Clap!!*

group_1.textCenter: H-hey! Stop that, all of you!
Kureha!@Come down from the podium already!
...Who on earth is she, Yuna Kureha.
